sage.shader

Class ShaderProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.shader.ShaderProgram
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GLSLShaderProgram

    public abstract class ShaderProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    ShaderProgram represents a program that can run on the GPU and is used to do shading. Currently only Vertex Shaders and Pixel/Fragment shaders are supported. Each ShaderProgram contains an array of Strings for each of the shaders present.
    Author:
    Morgan Darke

    • Method Detail

      • loadShaderSource

        public java.lang.String[] loadShaderSource(java.lang.String filename)
        This helper function is used to transform the contents of a file into an array of Strings used by the graphics compiler.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to be read
        Returns:
        An array of Strings containing the text in the file

      • init

        public abstract void init(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        This method will initialize the ShaderProgram by compiling and linking the Vertex and Fragment shaders. Since currently only OpenGL shaders are supported, this method takes a GL2 object as a parameter. This should be changed later to accommodate shaders written in other languages.
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL context

      • useShader

        public abstract void useShader(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        This method will make the program the current shader.
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL2 context

      • useFixedFunction

        public abstract void useFixedFunction(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        This function will unbind the shader program and the fixed function pipeline will be used instead.
        Parameters:
        gl -

      • getProgramID

        public abstract int getProgramID()
        This function returns the ID used to identify the shader program.
        Returns:
        the ID of the shader program

      • addUniform

        public abstract void addUniform(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl,
                                GLSLUniform<?> uniform)
        This function associates a uniform variable with the shader.
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL2 context
        uniform - The uniform variable

      • addUniform

        public abstract void addUniform(GLSLUniform<?> uniform)
        This function associates a uniform variable with the shader. However, the uniform variable is not yet bound to a location.
        Parameters:
        uniform - The uniform variable

      • getUniform

        public abstract GLSLUniform<?> getUniform(java.lang.String name)
        This function gets the uniform variable associated with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the uniform variable
        Returns:
        The uniform variable

      • applyUniformVariables

        public abstract void applyUniformVariables(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        This method sets values for all uniform variables used by the shader. In order for the values to be applied, the ShaderProgram must be the active program.
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL context

      • setUniformValue

        public abstract <E> void setUniformValue(java.lang.String name,
                                         E value)
        This method will set the value for the uniform variable with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the variable
        value - The value to set
